text: Napoleon Buck House was a historic home located near Waverly, Lafayette County, Missouri. It was built about 1873, and was a two-story, central passage plan, vernacular Greek Revival style brick I-house. It had a two-story rear ell supporting a double-gallery porch. It featured segmental arched openings. (includes 12 photographs from 1995) The house is no longer in existence. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1997. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Greek Revival houses in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1873 Category:Houses in Lafayette County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Lafayette County, Missouri
title: Napoleon Buck House
